DataElement.preferredDefinition: Result of immunologic testing based on the identification of any of the following criteria: 1) Appearance of serologic reactivity against CT antigens in previously seronegative patients; 2) IgMâ†’IgG class switch against CT antigens; 3) Two fold or greater increase in titer of IgGs recognizing CT antigens induced in epigenetically-modified autologous tumor cells; 4) Analysis of pre and post-vaccine T-cell subsets including CD4+CD25+ FoxP3 T reg cells by flow cytometry techniques. Additional analysis of T reg function by in vitro assays may be undertaken if warranted, based on results of flow cytometry experiments.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The study of the body's immune system._Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent._Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The study of the body's immune system.:Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Concepts.definition: The study of the immune system and its reaction to pathogens, as well as its malfunctions (autoimmune diseases, allergies, rejection of organ transplants).
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Property.preferredDefinition: Evaluation; the act of placing value on something.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.
